author: serenita_io
content:
Are you also testing running validators in separate validator clients, or only running validators directly inside CL clients?
I think this could make a (probably small) difference, but a large part of ETH mainnet runs with separate validator clients so would probably be good to take it into account. The larger these blocks get, the larger the difference would also get.

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
For blocks we have strategy which tries to get all forks especially when failed to retrieve one
For supplemental sidecars, yeah you are right we try to request it from all connected peers filtering only by custody requirements and throttling limits, so we don't know if this peer has this fork when requesting sidecars.

author: barnabasbusa
content: I've cleaned up some nodes that seemed to have been stuck syncing, and starting with a fresh db. Hopefully once all those peers come back online, we gonna have a very healthy chain

author: manunlp
content:
The TL;DR is for data column sidecars we make a map from peer to supposed custody columns for each needed root.
We select one peer randomly, try to fetch columns. We remove the peer from the map and if still some sidecars are missing after requesting this peer, we try an other one etc...

After making a whole iteration, if sidecars are still missing but we have enough to reconstruct, we reconstruct.
